text: Chloe Hewitt (born 27 July 1995) is an English dancer and choreographer. ==Early life== Hewitt was born in Chester. In 2013, Hewitt and dance partner AJ Pritchard auditioned for the seventh series of Britain's Got Talent where they reached the semi-finals. Hewitt and AJ Pritchard joined Strictly Come Dancing as professional dancers in 2016. ==Dance titles== Hewitt, along with AJ Pritchard, have been crowned World, European, and British National Ballroom and Latin Champions. ==Strictly Come Dancing== In July 2016, the BBC announced that Hewitt would join the cast of professional dancers on Strictly. Hewitt said of her appointment: "My childhood dream of being on Strictly Come Dancing is now reality! The sheer excitement is exhilarating." For the 2016 series, Hewitt was not paired with a celebrity. She did, however, perform in the professional dance numbers and appeared on the companion show—It Takes Two. Hewitt was partnered with Gethin Jones for the 2016 Christmas special. Hewitt returned for the 2017 series. Hewitt was partnered with Blue Peter presenter Radzi Chinyanganya in the 2017 Children In Need special. Hewitt was dropped from Strictly in May 2018. ==References== Category:1995 births Category:British ballroom dancers Category:Living people
title: Chloe Hewitt
